greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 3 * (b(q)^2/b(q^2)) / (c(q)^2/c(q^2)) in powers of q where b(), c() are cubic AGM theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of (phi(-q) / phi(-q^3))^4 in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of ((eta(q) / eta(q^3))^2 * (eta(q^6) / eta(q^2)))^4 in powers of q.
G.f.: A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2)) where f(u, v) = u * (1-v) * (9-v) - (u-v)^2.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (6 t)) = 9 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A128640.
a(n) = -8 * A123633(n) unless n=0. Convolution inverse of A128639.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q] / EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^3])^4, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Apr 06 2013 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (QPochhammer[ -q^3, q^3] / QPochhammer[ -q, q])^4 /(QPochhammer[ q^3] / QPochhammer[ q])^4, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Apr 06 2013 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( ((eta(x + A) / eta(x^3 + A))^2 * eta(x^6 + A) / eta(x^2 + A))^4, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 16 2007
